revised_title: Investigating the Sensible Difference between Mercurial and Air-Thermometers
tldr: This article examines the differences between mercurial and air-thermometers and their impact on theoretical research. The author compares the density of gases and the line of density, illustrating the effects of temperature corrections on the accuracy of measurements. The study concludes that the differences between the two thermometers are significant and cannot be neglected in theoretical research.
